;周四，伊朗当局在大批民众面前公开处决了一名男子，这是一项权利该组织表示，谴责伊斯兰共和国绞刑激增的“中世纪”做法。

;

;这名男子被判犯有“人间腐败”的死罪，在位于挪威的伊朗人权组织 (IHR) 表示，位于阿塞拜疆北部省份马拉盖市。

;

;“国际社会不能认可这种中世纪的做法”，IHR 主任 Mahmood Amiry-Moghaddam 说，并补充说处决显示了“政府试图通过对社会的残忍、羞辱和恐吓来延长其生命的真实面目”。

;

;伊朗新闻网站上发布的图片显示似乎有数百人聚集在检察官向记者发表讲话时，在安全录像带后面观看处决。

;

;伊朗称已处决了一个妇女贩卖网络的头目

;

;这名男子被蒙住眼睛，旁边是他的两个刽子手戴着头套。另一张照片显示，他在行刑前站在椅子上，脖子上套着套索，然后用一根绳子吊在空中，绳子系在一台死后的起重机上。死亡的时刻本身并没有显示。

;

;这名罪犯大约在五年前首次被捕，但没有透露姓名，他被判犯有与女性关系有关的指控，尽管所指控的具体性质罪行尚不清楚。

;

;根据国际特赦组织等人权组织的数据，伊朗每年处决的人比中国以外的任何国家都多，但公开处决相对罕见，几乎所有绞刑都在监狱内进行。

; p>;

;根据 IHR，2021 年没有公开处决。

;

;2022 年 7 月，伊恩在设拉子市公开绞死了一名被判谋杀警察的男子，12 月在马什哈德处决了穆赫森·拉纳瓦德 (Mohsen Rahnavard)，他参加了最近的反政府抗议浪潮，并因谋杀民兵特工而被定罪。

;

;但最近的处决特别不寻常，因为它发生在白天面对大量媒体存在的大量人群。 2022 年的两次公开处决似乎都是在黎明前进行的，几乎没有旁观者。

;

;伊朗在 1 月和 2 月处决了近 100 人：大赦

;

;伊朗目前处决人数激增2022 年 9 月，玛莎·阿米尼 (Mahsa Amini) 因涉嫌违反该国严格的着装规定而被捕后在拘留期间死亡，随后爆发了抗议浪潮，人权组织表示处决的目的是恐吓公众。

;

;七迄今为止，已有多名男子在与抗议相关的案件中被处以绞刑，而国际特赦组织本周警告称，另有 7 名与抗议有关的男子面临被处决的风险。

;

;根据《国际卫生条例》，今年已有 278 人被处决仅一年。

; Thu, 25 May 2023 23:50:02 +0800 China is supersizing its rocket industry – and it’s coming for Starlinkhttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/science/article/3221831/china-supersizing-its-rocket-industry-and-its-coming-starlink?utm_source=rss_feed

;中国的火箭工业即将获得巨大的推动力。

;

;据参与该项目的科学家称，该国正在建造一座史无前例的火箭组装厂，每年可生产 50 枚长征八号火箭。

;

;一旦明年完工，这个位于热带岛屿海南岛的大型工厂将中国的年发射能力几乎翻了一番——已经是世界上最大的发射能力之一。

;

;根据公开信息，没有任何其他现有设施能够以这样的速度制造火箭。去年，Elon Musk 的 SpaceX 记录了 61 次发射，其中大部分使用可重复使用的猎鹰火箭。

;

;长征八号是一种低成本、不可重复使用的火箭，可以容纳 20 多颗 Starlink 大小的通信卫星.中国打算使用已经两次成功试射的中型运载火箭，每年将 1000 多颗卫星送入太空，与目前 SpaceX 的速度相当。

;

;但新火箭是还旨在将卫星置于比 Starlink 卫星更高的轨道上。更有利的高度将使中国卫星能够监视甚至压制他们的美国竞争对手。

;

;“建造巨型卫星星座的竞赛正在推动中国的航天工业进入一个新时代”，高级研究员宋正宇说领导长征 8 号团队的中国运载火箭技术研究院 (CALT) 的火箭科学家在上个月发表在《中国宇航学报》上的一篇论文中。

;

;

;

;为了赶上 SpaceX 的星链计划，除了目前在轨的 4,000 多颗卫星之外，中国还计划发射近 13,000 颗卫星。

;

;该项目代号为“GW”-据一些解放军科学家称，它专门用于在发生战争时压制 Starlink 的全球服务。

;

;但宋及其同事表示，中国目前的火箭阵容无法胜任这项任务。他们说，现有的长征火箭要么太小，要么太大。

;

;长征八号旨在填补这一空白，效率空前。

;

;它“可以满足超过中国90%的后续发射任务要求是中低轨”，宋说。

;

;同时，中国现有的火箭生产方式无法达到GW项目要求的速度，根据火箭科学家的说法。

;

;传统的火箭生产涉及工人组装不同的部件，然后将它们连接到火箭的固定位置。火箭本身并不沿着生产线移动，而是停留在一个地方，而工人们则绕着它移动以完成他们的任务。

;

;一些现代火箭制造商已经开始采用脉冲装配线技术——类似于过去使用的技术在战斗机生产中 – 以加快装配速度并降低成本。

;

;SpaceX 开发了一种称为“猎鹰 9 号集成装配线”的自动化系统，该系统使用同步脉冲在装配过程中快速高效地移动火箭部件.与传统方法相比，该方法使 SpaceX 能够以更低的成本生产更多的火箭。

;

;海南文昌的长征 8 号工厂将与 SpaceX 的工厂类似，但也将具有一些独特的优势，据称宋的团队。

;

;中国公布了月球研究站的建设路线图

;

;要使脉冲装配线有效，它必须稳定供应高质量的部件，以便快速

;

;在中国，这样的任务相对容易以具有竞争力的成本实现，因为该国拥有世界上最大的许多工业产品制造能力，包括那些需要高学历的产品

;

;

;

;使用现有的长征火箭将 1 千克（2.2 磅）货物送入近地轨道 (LEO) 的成本约为 3,000 美元，类似于中国最大的火箭制造商中国航天科技集团公司的研究人员最近发布的一份报告显示，SpaceX 的可重复使用的猎鹰 9 号火箭的成本。

;

;Song 的团队表示，他们已经找到了进一步降低成本的方法长征八号，其中一些以前从未尝试过。

;

;模态测试是一个艰苦的过程，它测量结构的自然频率和振型，可以帮助工程师了解结构在不同载荷下的行为和条件。历史上，未进行模态试验的火箭都经历过重大失败。

;

;长征八号火箭是世界上第一枚无需全尺寸模态试验就成功飞行的火箭。相反，科学家们使用模拟来获得允许成功发射的动态参数，即使在取消助推器和更换整流罩之后也是如此。

;

;通过使用最新的数字设计和模拟工具，“开发周期缩短了 12 个月，该团队在论文中称，“节省了大量试验资金”。优化火箭的轨迹。

;

;具体而言，在第二阶段飞行的第一部分，火箭沿着亚轨道路径滑向特定目标。然后，在第二阶段的第二部分，它切换到动力飞行以到达其最终目标轨道。

;

;该方法可以更精确地控制火箭的轨迹，并可以帮助它适应偏离其目标轨道的情况预期的路径。这很难实现，因为它需要火箭飞行不同阶段之间的精确计时和协调。

;

;在太空中滑翔很困难，因为没有空气阻力来帮助控制火箭的运动。据宋的团队称，这种新方法是火箭技术的一项关键进步，可以提高太空任务的准确性和效率。

;

;为了进一步降低成本，长征八号不再需要三重冗余惯性测量单元 (IMU) 配置。相反，它使用简化的双 IMU 配置。这需要新技术来提高飞行的可靠性和智能性，并使用替代方法来解决潜在的故障。

;

;

;

;龙的团队表示，长征八号火箭经过优化，可以将卫星发送到高度为 700 公里（435 英里）的太阳同步轨道 (SSO)，高于大多数运行在 550 公里左右的星链卫星。

;

;目前，SSO 主要用于地球观测卫星。之所以称为“太阳同步”，是因为卫星每天都在同一本地时间经过地球上的任何给定点，这使得对温度、植被生长和洋流等事物进行一致的测量变得更加容易。

;< p>;SSO 与大多数 Starlink 卫星使用的 LEO 相比，既有优点也有缺点。一个优点是它允许更一致和准确的数据收集，因为卫星在一天的同一时间经过同一区域。

;

;因为它们在更高的地方，SSO 卫星也更容易与之通信因为它们与地面站的视线更清晰。

;

;不过，SSO 也有缺点。进入这种类型的轨道需要更多的能量，而且由于 SSO 中的卫星比 LEO 中的卫星离地球更远，因此它们的响应速度较慢，传输数据的速度也较慢。

;

;一些通信卫星用于据中国军事科学家称，GW 项目将配备用于观察或其他目的的传感器和其他设备。

;

;中国航天初创公司发射了世界上第一枚“煤动力”火箭

;

;据科学家称，如果中国能够使用其 SSO 卫星跟踪 Starlink 卫星并收集有关其移动和活动的数据，它就可以使用这些信息来干扰或破坏 Starlink 的运行。

;

;但是，那，将是一项艰巨的任务。批评人士表示，如此复杂且具有挑战性的任务将需要大量资源和专业知识，而中国干涉或破坏“星链”的任何企图都可能对国际关系和太空政策造成严重后果。

;

;

;

;中国的新火箭工厂是文昌正在建设的一个更大的商业航天中心的一部分，该中心预计将于明年 6 月首次发射。

;

;根据 CALT 在社交媒体上发布的一份声明，月，工人和工程师加班加点赶工期。

;

;第一发射台主体结构提前20天完工，以“每10天一层”的速度完成，声明

;

;据文昌市政府称，海南即将到来的雨季和台风季节可能会减缓建设进度。

;

;当地政府表示，他们正在主动提供“门- 到门”服务来支持项目——处理各种任务，包括文书工作和审批——帮助加快项目指挥中心的行政工作。

;

;“一切都围绕项目展开，一切都围绕项目完成这个项目，”文昌市政府在其网站上说。

; Thu, 25 May 2023 23:20:02 +0800 Microsoft founder Bill Gates, award-winning US scientists set to speak at China’s Zhongguancun forum, with AI in focushttps://www.scmp.com/tech/tech-war/article/3221810/microsoft-founder-bill-gates-award-winning-us-scientists-set-speak-chinas-zhongguancun-forum-ai?utm_source=rss_feed

;微软创始人比尔盖茨和一些美国顶尖科学家将参加中国政府支持的年度技术会议将于周四晚上在北京开幕，因为该国寻求促进该领域的国际合作。

;

;盖茨，作为比尔及梅琳达盖茨基金会的联席主席出席据该活动的官方网站介绍，他与前妻共同创立的私人慈善基金会定于周五在中关村论坛上发表演讲。

;

;为期六天的会议主题为“开放”北京市副市长余英杰上周表示，“合作共创未来”，将聚焦“科技发展前沿”，包括人工智能 (AI)。

;

;由于论坛是首届余说，在中国 Covid 重新开放后，在中关村地区（北京对硅谷的回应）举行的大型国际会议，超过 40% 的演讲者将是外国嘉宾。

;

;John Hopcroft，计算机1986 年获得图灵奖的康奈尔大学科学教授、诺贝尔奖获得者亚美尼亚裔美国分子生物学家 Ardem Patapoutian 以及中国生物物理学家施一公和联合创始人兼首席执行官李彦宏均在名单中。中国人工智能和搜索巨头百度。

;

;主办方没有立即回应有关受邀嘉宾是亲自出席还是通过视频通话的询问。

;

;会议恰逢其时当美国初创公司 OpenAI 的对话机器人 ChatGPT 将这项技术置于聚光灯下时，随着中国与美国的技术竞争加剧。

;

;盖茨和李都一直在谈论人工智能技术的潜力。微软是 OpenAI 的投资方，而百度是第一家在中国推出 ChatGPT 替代方案的中国大公司。

;

;盖茨本周早些时候表示，人工智能可以作为个人数字助理并取代网站，例如亚马逊和谷歌。后者在 3 月发布了其 ChatGPT 竞争对手 Bard。

;

;李一再强调，百度的未来在于人工智能。他在上周的财报电话会议上表示，“生成式人工智能和大型语言模型的出现为人工智能在各个行业带来了变革潜力”。

;

;自 2007 年以来每年举办的中关村论坛是由科技部、国家发展和改革委员会、工业和信息化部、中国科学院等八个政府机构和附属机构组织。

;

;该活动历来是北京促进技术交流的载体。 2021 年，中国国家主席习近平在会议上发表讲话，表示中国将采取“更加开放的态度”并参与“全球创新网络”。

;

;然而，华盛顿和北京之间在诸如此类问题上的紧张关系加剧

;

;根据福克斯新闻本月早些时候的报道，拜登政府目前正在考虑进一步限制美国对中国人工智能公司和其他敏感技术的投资。

;

;与此同时，北京周日宣布美国芯片制造商美光科技未通过网络安全审查，并禁止向中国关键信息基础设施运营商销售其产品。

;英国一名 TikTokker 被法官禁止发布视频，除非他获得许可在一段病毒式传播的视频中，他未经许可进入一个陌生人的房子并拍摄了他们的反应。

;

;18 岁的 Bacari-Bronze O'Garro 在 TikTok 上更广为人知的名字是 Mizzy，他在那里建立了一个在被踢下平台之前，他以爱恶作剧而闻名。

;

;他的视频显示他未经许可闯入人们的前门，带着一位老妇人的狗逃跑，并在街上问妇女“你想死吗？ ？”

;

;据 BBC 报道，奥加罗出现在伦敦泰晤士河地方法院，并承认制作视频违反了早些时候的法院命令。

;

;据 BBC 报道，检察官说去年，奥加罗发布了几个他似乎针对犹太人的视频后，就收到了该命令。报告称，该命令禁止他擅自侵入私人财产。

;

;亚裔澳大利亚人热泪盈眶的越南 TikTok 引发了“贫民窟旅游”的强烈反对

;

;然而，在一个视频中，发布一周前，奥加罗和他的一群朋友进入伦敦的一所房子，似乎吓到了屋里的人。他从一个女人身边走过，女人问他在做什么，然后喊她的丈夫“到前门来”。

;

;O'Garro 和其他人进入屋子，开始四处张望.有一次，他坐在沙发上。 O'Garro 告诉一个上前与他们对质的人，他们正在寻找一个“学习小组”。

;

;原始帖子不再可用，但该视频已重新分享到 Twitter 上浏览量达 2900 万次。

;

;据 BBC 报道，法院获悉这对有年幼孩子的夫妇对此事件感到痛苦。

;

;“受害人并不知道 O 先生据伦敦标准晚报报道，这家人的检察官 Varinder Hayre 说，“Garro 正在记录这件事。”

;

;“他拍下了她丈夫和孩子的脸。她强烈认为他让她的家人处于危险之中。”

;

;据标准报报道，O'Garro 的律师 Lee Sergent 说他的当事人向家人道歉并感到懊悔。

;

;“他从未打算他的行为造成任何痛苦或不安”，他说。 “可以公平地说，他认为他所做的是一个无害的恶作剧”。

;

;Sergent 补充说，O'Garro“在某种程度上被怂恿去做更多的内容以获得更多的喜欢和根据 Standard 的报道，他的追随者”，并由单亲抚养长大。

;

;“他是一个聪明的年轻人，也是一个有一定潜力的年轻人，”他说。

;

;印度尼西亚 TikTokker 在吃了“刚刚好”的猪皮后被指控亵渎神明

;

;法官夏洛特·克兰格 (Charlotte Crangle) 说她看过录像，可以理解这对夫妇的痛苦。

;

;她说：“你表达了悔意，并回头向他们道歉，这让我感到放心。”

;

;Crangle 下令 O'Garro 不得在未经允许的情况下在社交媒体上发布任何视频他们中的每个人，并且不侵犯私有财产。她还向他发出了一项为期两年的犯罪行为令，以及 200 英镑（247 美元）的罚款和 165 英镑（185 美元）的罚款。

;Hong Kong's new electronic toll system will be extended to the Lion Rock Tunnel on Sunday – but transport officials admitted they did not expect an immediate reduction in traffic congestion at the crossing.

;

;But transport chiefs on Thursday said they were confident the implementation of the HKeToll system at the tunnel would be successful after the earlier smooth launches at the Tsing-Sha control area on May 7 and the Shing Mun Tunnel on May 21.

;

;“In the past month, we have accumulated a certain amount of experience on running the new system in the two tunnels. So we believe that the system will be implemented successfully at the Lion Rock Tunnel,” Commissioner for Transport Rosanna Law Shuk-pui explained.

;

;“We do not anticipate the system would help cut congestion remarkably at the initial stage. But we believe that with motorists getting more familiar using the system and all toll booths being removed, vehicles are expected to move faster through the tunnel.”

;

;The electronic system will allow drivers to pay the flat rate of HK$8 (US$1) without having to stop at toll booths or queue up.

;

;The new payment method will go live at 5am on Sunday and there will be some permanent lane closures as a result.

;

;The seven lanes to the Kowloon Tong side of the tunnel will be cut to three. The number of lanes to the Sha Tin entrance will be halved from six to three. Toll booths will close for good.

;

;The entire tunnel will be closed from 4.30am to 5am.

;

;Some bus routes will be affected – the N170, N182, N271, N281, and N373, as well as six overnight New Territories green minibus routes, including 61S, 63S, 65S, 501S, 616S, and 805S.

;

;Lanes to Kowloon Tong will be closed in stages from 10pm on Saturday and those at Sha Tin will be closed from 1am on Sunday.

;

;16 per cent of Hong Kong cars detected without fully set up toll payment app

;

;But at least one lane and three toll booths will remain open in both directions at any one time until 4.30am.

;

;The Transport Department said 90,000 vehicles pass through the Lion Rock Tunnel, which links Kowloon Tong and Sha Tin, every day.

;

;About 60,000 vehicles use the Tsing-Sha control area each day and 50,000 vehicles travel through the Shing Mun Tunnel a day.

;

;Chief Traffic Engineer (New Territories East) Albert Ho Kwan-hang said the department had issued about 740,000 tags for the e-toll system, which account for more than 91 per cent of the licensed vehicles in the city.

;

;About 80 per cent of tag holders have opened an HKeToll account and 70 per cent of them have already set up automatic payment methods.

;

;Ho added that there were around 10 complaints a day about incorrect charges made to the department after the system was introduced at the two earlier crossings.

;

;Smooth start on first working day for Hong Kong's automatic tunnel fee system

;

;Law highlighted that 5 per cent of vehicles using the Shing Mun Tunnel did not carry a tag. She said the figure for the Tsing-Sha control area was higher, but still in the single digits.

;

;HKeToll requires road users to apply for a tag, which is scanned at the tunnel for fares, open a special account online and create a payment method.

;

;Vehicle owners who have set up HKeToll account with a payment method will get a successful transaction notification when they go through the tunnel.

;

;Drivers without the HKeToll tag or who have yet to set up a payment method will get an electronic payment notice and are required to settle the account inside 14 business days or face a surcharge of HK$175, raised to HK$350 after 21 days.

;

;Motorists will face legal action if they refuse to pay.

; Thu, 25 May 2023 21:20:02 +0800 China’s economic recovery is being held back by lagging private sector, household concerns, senior adviser warnshttps://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3221794/chinas-economic-recovery-being-held-back-lagging-private-sector-household-concerns-senior-adviser?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.05.25 21:00;
;;

;The widening gap in the rate of recovery of China's private sector and its state-owned enterprises has become a big hurdle for a full economic rebound, a senior government adviser warned this week.

;

;More proactive fiscal policy – especially from the central government – was needed to support smaller firms and households, said Liu Yuanchun, president of the Shanghai University of Finance and Economics.

;

;“The current policy implementation is not strong enough to support a full-scale economic recovery,” Liu told a webinar organised by the China Macroeconomy Forum on Monday.

;

;Ministry of Finance statistics showed that the first-quarter profits of state-owned enterprises rose 12.4 per cent year on year to 1.12 trillion yuan (US$158.7 billion).

;

;But Liu said small and medium-sized enterprises in the private sector, especially those at the downstream ends of supply chains and those in the services sector, had seen profits decline further.

;

;A pillar of China's economy, the private sector contributes more than half of the country's tax revenue, 60 per cent of its gross domestic product, fixed-asset investment and foreign direct investment, and more than 80 per cent of urban employment.

;

;China's tech regulator meets Big Tech bosses, including Didi CEO

;

;But it bore the brunt of economic pressure under almost three years of strict Covid-19 restrictions from early 2020, adding to the impact of regulatory crackdowns on technology giants and private tutoring.

;

;“From the perspective of private enterprises, when a large amount of funds and subsidised projects are pouring into state-owned enterprises, the recovery effect that fiscal policy produces is not obvious,” Liu said. “Although the confidence of market players has improved, they are still relatively depressed.”

;

;As a result, the year-to-date growth rate of private sector fixed-asset investment since China reopened at the end of last year had fallen from 0.9 per cent in December to 0.4 per cent in April, according to the National Bureau of Statistics.

;

;Meanwhile, the slow growth of household incomes, especially for lower-income groups, had suppressed people's willingness to consume, further impeding economic recovery, Liu added.

;

;In the first quarter of the year, China's per capita disposable income was 10,870 yuan, up 3.8 per cent year on year after deducting price factors but lower than the 4.5 per cent GDP growth in the same period.

;

;“At present, a contractionary distribution appears in the national income distribution, that is to say, a large amount of funds are used for investment instead of consumption,” Liu said.

;

;China's hot new consumption trends show lingering weakness in spending

;

;“The decline in income will cause a decline in demand, which will further affect prices, and then affect profits, resulting in a cycle of price decline and wage income reduction. If this cycle occurs, it will have a negative impact on the next stage of recovery.”

;

;Lacklustre income growth has coincided with a soaring youth unemployment rate. In April, the unemployment rate for the 16-24 age group hit a record high of 20.4 per cent, up from 19.6 per cent in March, according to NBS statistics.

;

;With a record 11.6 million university graduates set to enter the job market this year, the situation could worsen in the coming months, analysts said.

;

;Liu said a wave of pay cuts in various industries – led by the finance sector – and a sluggish property and stock market had further weakened the income prospects of Chinese households, which was not favourable for the restoration of expectations and consumption.

;

;China needs to let some local governments file for bankruptcy as debts mount

;

;He added that the poor fiscal condition of local governments had made it difficult to implement Beijing's fiscal policies at the grass roots, and the central government needed to shoulder a bigger responsibility by front-loading its fiscal tools and introducing more expansionary policies.

;

;“At the current stage, it is very important for the central government to assume a greater responsibility,” Liu said.

;Nuri's third flight marked the first attempt to load and launch a “commercial-grade” satellite with the home-grown launch vehicle, KARI said in a statement.

;

;This flight is aimed at verifying locally-developed, sophisticated radar known as synthetic-aperture radar (SAR) in space, as well as conducting space research missions including measuring cosmic radiations, it said.

;

;SARs are less affected by weather than optical cameras and can be used in the absence of daylight.

;

;Nuri, also known as KSLV-II, performed its maiden flight in October 2021, carrying a 1,500kg dummy satellite payload.

;

;Even though it reached the targeted apex of 700km, it failed to reach an intended orbital velocity as its third stage shut down prematurely.

;

;Last June's flight, the second involving a domestic space rocket, fared much better by placing a dummy satellite and four miniature satellites called CubeSats into orbit, marking the first time a satellite was launched from South Korea using a home-grown rocket.

;

;KARI said more flights are needed to make Nuri more reliable as a launch vehicle to put locally developed satellites into orbit.

;

;The 2 trillion-won (US$1.52 billion) Nuri project, which began in 2010 will continue until 2027 with three additional rocket launches; a next-generation mid-sized satellite in 2025, five micro satellites in 2026 and another five micro satellites in 2027.

;

;How South Korea cribbed from SpaceX to launch its space ambitions

;

;Lee Il-woo, an analyst at the think tank Korea Defence Network, ruled out the possibility of converting Nuri into military missiles, because unlike ballistic missiles that use solid fuel Nuri is liquid-propelled.

;

;Solid fuel eliminates the need to fuel missiles just before launch, which would increase response time and potentially be spotted by enemies.

;

;“Instead, Nuri allows South Korea to enhance its space reconnaissance capability by building a network of many small satellites at times and places of its own choice in the future”, Lee told This Week in Asia.

;

;South Korea plans to invest an additional 2 trillion won (US$1.5 billion) over the next 10 years to develop another KSLV-III launch vehicle which is expected to come online in 2030 to launch a 1.5-tonne robotic lunar lander by 2032.

;

;Nuri's flight comes as neighbouring North Korea is upgrading its space centre to accommodate the increased demands of leader Kim Jong-un, who last month called for the country to launch its first spy satellite into orbit to monitor US forces and their allies in Asia.

;

;South Korea's National Security Adviser Cho Tae-yong said any potential launch from Pyongyang could lead to further sanctions.

;

;“There's a chance of a launch in the near future. In such an event … it would end up deepening North Korea's diplomatic isolation in the international community,” Cho told Yonhap News TV.

;

;Kim visited a Preparatory Committee for the satellite launch last week and approved its “future action plan”, the North's Korean Central News Agency said, hinting the launch could be imminent.

;

;If it happens, it would be the North's first space rocket launch since February 2016 when Pyongyang claimed it had put an earth-observation satellite into orbit despite scepticism abroad.

;

;“There's definitely a rivalry between the two Koreas in terms of what they're trying to set up in space,” said military historian David Silbey, director of teaching and learning at Cornell University's programme in Washington.

;

;“One of the things satellites are used for is targeting nuclear weapons,” Silbey said. “It's worth being really nervous about North Korea having this kind of high-end capacity.”

;

;The sky's no limit: US military launches space force in South Korea

;

;While the country is barred by United Nations Security Council resolutions from conducting ballistic missile tests, Pyongyang has long claimed it's entitled to have a civilian space programme for satellite launches.

;

;Analysts warn that technology derived from North Korea's space programme could be used to advance its ballistic missile technology.

;

;“The North is likely to use a launch vehicle using solid-fuel propellant in an ICBM (intercontinental ballistic missile) test disguised as a space satellite launch,” said Lee Il-woo of the Korea Defence Network.

;

;David Schmerler, a senior research associate at the James Martin Center for Nonproliferation Studies, said if North Korea can successfully launch and place an imaging satellite into orbit, it would use the images to try and refine their targeting list.

;

;“The potential threat from North Korea would notionally remain the same, but with better or more up-to-date imagery, that threat would be more refined – and more effectively deployed – if used,” he said.
